titleStmt.title: A copy of two remonstrances, brought over the river Stix in Carons ferry-boate; by the ghost of Sir John Suckling. The one, to the Earle of New-Castle and the popish army. The other, to the Protestants of England. Wherein is many things mentioned worthy the due observation of all those that love God and King Charles; and desire peace.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
